amendment.description: Amendment originally sought to appropriate $18.6 million for operation of the Office of Technology Assessment. \ As amended by the Houghton substitute amendment (A006), the above was replaced with language that transfers $15 million to the Congressional Research Service to enable CRS to assume the functions of the Office of Technology Assessment.
amendment.purpose: An amendment, as amended by the Houghton amendment, to reduce the appropriation for the Library of Congress by $15 million and to increase the appropriation for the Congressional Research Service by an equal amount, to enable CRS to assume the functions of the Office of Technology Assessment. The amendment is identical to amendment No. 5, as amended by amendment No. 6, on which the proceedings of June 21, 1995 were vacated.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Fazio amendment (A007) as amended Agreed to by recorded vote: 220 - 204 (Roll no. 410).
